intro: Delphinium sinense var. pumilum, commonly known as the dwarf Chinese larkspur, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of China. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, making it a compact and elegant addition to gardens. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This variety is valued for its ornamental qualities and is often cultivated in moist, well-drained soils in partial shade.
